body.p:
W. T. Cahill a citizen of Harrodsburg Mercer County Ky states on oath that he was present when John Patterson, the person named in Jno. D Hales Petition to Govr Bramlette was recruited by said Hale, and when he joined the Company which Capt Hale was raising for the 2d Ky heavy artillery & afterwards transferred to 4th Ky Mounted Infantry and witness saw said Patterson sworn in at the time as a United States Soldier, -- This was all done about three weeks before the charge of rescuing him by Capt Hale was made, & before the Indictment against sd Hale, and he ^Patterson^ was a regular member of said company at the time the charge of rescuing him was made -- He further states that sd Capt. Jno. D Hale a few days after the occurance & charge of rescue delivered over said John Patterson to the civil authority of Mercer County & that
said Patterson is now under bond for his appearance in the Mercer Circuit Court with good surety, to argue the charge against him --
Sworn to before me by W. T. Cahill this 20th June 1864.

J W Cardwell N P
Mercer Co Ky
L. M. Donovan states on oath that he Knows the statements of the foregoing affidavit of W. T. Cahill are true --
Sworn to before me by L M Donivan this 20 June 1864

J.W. Cardwell N P.
Mercer Co Ky
